title: One shotting (autos/abilities)
body: As the title says this is about champs that can one shot from 1-2 auto attacks and abilities, it is NOT healthy for this game and does NOT belong in a game, like league of legends champions that can one shot with either an auto attack or an ability should be reworked or heavily nerfed. You should not have more than 80% of your hp removed from 1 simple action I'm not sure why this has never been discussed but it is extremely unhealthy for this game and it needs to be fixed or at least looked into.

replies.body:
i feel that one shotting should still be allowed as
you can just build tank 
or you can pick a champ that has cc
or you can pick a champ that can 1 shot

How is Ashe supposed to build tank?
Or Orianna?
Or Sona? 
Etc.

Are you implying we shouldn't pick any champs other than tanks? 
Because that used to be a thing a couple of seasons back, where if you had less than 3 tanks on your team, it was basically a guaranteed loss! and pretty much everyone will tell you it was a hell of a lot worse than what we have now.

Balance shouldn't be a "if you can't beat em, join em!" thing.
It should be that you just play who you want to play and who fits into your team comps best. You shouldn't have to write off 60% of the champions just because they can't build tank.

I am wildy against the amount of damage in this game, _(honestly there needs to be a 20% damage reduction across the whole board)_.
And for the most part, I disagree with 1-shotting, its nearly impossible to 'counterplay' when Draven flashes out of the fog of war and removes you from this world, before you have time to understand what is happening.

However there are some _(very few, but some)_ instances where 1-shotting is acceptable imo.

Zoe is one. Unlike champs like Draven and Jarvan, Zoe's entire kit is built around 1-shotting. This means that unlike the other two, either she 1-shots you and you die, or she cant 1-shot you, and she's useless. Her combo requires a lot of setup and is easily countered. Her sleepy trouble bubble gives you enough time to get behind minions or activate any defences you have, e.g. spellshiled/Zhonyas/Self-buff etc. And all parts of her combo have enough clear warning about what she's about to do and where it will be coming from.

Second is Veigar. Veigar's whole identity is 'that terrifying little shit that pops you.' remove his 1-shot ability and it removes all he is, you cant have an infinitely scaling mage, and expect him not to be able to 1-hit things later in the game. What is balanced about Veigar is that he can 1-shot you, but unlike Draven/Rengo etc. he can do it easily ONCE. After his ult is gone he has to hit his W for any meaningful damage, and its hard for him to do that without his E, and that is both hard to hit and has a lengthy cooldown, so after he has 1-shot you, his damage has a lot of counterplay, meaning your team can easily dispatch him. He cant just jump into a 1v4 and burst down everyone.

This one I say with a little more reluctance:  Jhin's 4th shot shouldn't be a 1-shot, but it should have enough damage to feel like one.
If it was up to me, id make Jhin's basic attacks unable to crit, and any crit chance he has increases the damage of his 4th shot. As it stands now, the 4th shot is definitely stronger, but not enough to truly deter many attackers. It should be that when he has his 4th shot up, even shit like Zed is afraid to go in on him. However this also means that his regular attacks are less powerful, to balance it out. After all, he is more of a burst ADC than a sustained one. And he has to get through his first 3 shots before he has access to his 4th, so its not like he can just press a button and suddenly have it available, which gives champs time to either kill him, or get the fuck out.

________________________

Those are the instances off the top of my head, where 1-shotting is appropriate.
Rengar leaping out of nowhere and putting you through the blender? **NO.**
Draven killing your entire team with 6 auto attacks? **NO.**
Jarvan pressing R? **NO.**
Kat shunpo/ult to you _(and you dying in the first 0.2 seconds of her ult)_? **NO.**


Assassins should be able to 100-0 squishy champs pretty much at any time. However they should have to land **all** their kit in order to do so, _(the number of times I've managed to avoid all Zed's shurikens and still been melted, is ridiculous)_.

Sustained damage champs _(with the exception of Jhin's 4th shot as mentioned above)_, should never, under any circumstances, ever be able to 1-shot you.
Azir/Cassiopeia/Ashe/Vayne/Aurelion Sol/Jax/Kindred/Kog/Nasus/Darius etc etc. their damage is 'sustained' which by definition means they should have to be attacking you for a while in order to kill you.

what's your opinion on shaco? 
Realistically if a shaco decides to q in and auto you, he's in for the long and short, and if you don't get bursted, likely he will, clone buys a split second, but it certainly isn't a get out of jail free card, and realistically since the clone takes extra damage and shaco is squishy, you'll likely both die in 3 hits anyway, if you try to ult from point blank and escape (not to say ult isn't an amazing utility tool, but it's not an escape).

I think he's good, but my main issue with Shaco is the classification of his invisibility.
Having him not shown up by red wards makes his ganks insanely strong, and more often than not, he can use his invis a second time, defensively, during the fight to escape, or confuse the target.

I think, his invis should count as 'invisible' when not in combat, but when he is in combat _(within X seconds of dealing/taking damage etc)_ his Q should count as 'camouflage' instead. Allowing him to be seen by red wards and other similar revealing abilities.

This keeps his ganking potential insanely good, but lets his opponents counterplay his defensive capability during fights.

______________


Apart from that, Shaco seems relatively balanced to me, he comes in, assassinates a target, causes a little havoc with his ult and traps, and escapes in the confusion. Just what an assassin ought to do.

He deals a bit too much sustained damage _(considering his high burst)_ for my liking, especially with his crits and ult, but unlike other assassins like Zed or Fizz, he remains very squishy all through the game, so it balances out quite evenly.

Overall, I think he is one of the assassins that portrays the role of 'assassin' very accurately, much like Kassadin, Talon and LB.
Less of the tanker jump-in-and-wreak-havoc-with-my-AoE-then-pick-off-the-survivors 'fighter-assassins' such as Yasuo/Zed/Fizz/Ekko etc.

shaco's q is a fairly long cd, so it really is only either engage or disengage, you can't use it for both. It's really not something you can use twice in a fight. It isn't like a khazix jump, 16s-14s is a considerable cooldown even with the 2.5s refund isn't an escape plan, shaco q will get you in, but your escape plan generally relies on your team. 

I don't agree with your statement of shaco can q in, assassinate someone, and then q out, using q twice in a short fight. Escaping (if at all) once you've failed to assassinate someone for a shaco is generally alot less dignified than you're making it seem because q will be on cooldown, and so you've just got to hope you can walk out.

Also for me shaco embodies a strong ideal of feast or famine. With very subpar base damages and no natural damage steroids or sustain, if shaco falls behind, he really falls behind, however the strength of his gank potential can also make him very very dangerous when ahead, and really difficult to play around. I feel assassins should be the threat of a snowball, but also the risk of falling behind, and have poor scaling into lategame, but a good midgame.

Also he doesn't have any more consistent damage than any other assassin, as shaco has no damage steroids, his e has about the same damage as Khazix W, and 130% extra damage crit (not a real crit, does less damage than kha passive) on his first backstab, isn't exactly high dps. Overall Shaco's main power comes from being ahead of the item curve.

Also boxes are hard to pull off, planning where to box to create an opening and where to box to make an exit is very hard and can fall apart if you can't predict enemies.

I know you hate assassins, but I feel you're biased sometimes. Shaco is a game balance issue because he has unhealthy mechanics, if it wasn't for the fact that his abilities do inherently unfair things around his gameplay style, or how his boxes allow him to setup unfair scenarios, statwise he's got some of the worst scaling and dps out of any assassin.

Im not quite sure what you want, you asked my what my opinion on Shaco was.
the vast majority of it was:

> I think he's good. - Shaco seems relatively balanced to me. - Just what an assassin ought to do. - Overall, I think he is one of the assassins that portrays the role of 'assassin' very accurately. - He remains very squishy all through the game, so it balances out quite evenly. - Less of the tanker jump-in-and-wreak-havoc-with-my-AoE-then-pick-off-the-survivors 'fighter-assassins' such as Yasuo/Zed/Fizz/Ekko etc.

Thats about as good a praise from me that any assassin has ever had. And you're still calling me bias?

I don't hate assassins at all. I hate when assassins do multiple jobs _(Vayne being a marksman AND an assassin, or Yasuo being a fighter AND an assassin, or Lee being a tank AND an assassin.)_ because by definition if an assassin is capable of doing another job, then it completely counteracts the weaknesses a true assassin should have.

I have 1 issue with shaco, thats him being able to escape with his invis. _(I probably have more issues with Azir's kit than I do with Shaco's)_. With CDR it has a 5.2 second cooldown. That is easily enough to use it twice in a fight. Thats less time than Zoe's trouble bubble, and we all know how many times she can use that in a fight.

With the CC from his traps, and the confusion of his ult, Shaco can easily live long enough to use his invis to escape. In fact It happened several times the last game I played against him. Thats just fact, you can argue it as much as you want, but I see it happen.

Many Shacos build crit _(Shiv/IE etc)_, and anyone with AD and crit, has sustained damage! 
But like I said, Shaco's sustained damage isn't a huge worry because he is so squishy.

________________

I disagree that assassins should be feast or famine.

By stating that assassins are balanced if they are feast or famine champs, the balance team is essentially saying _"Its fair if they become unstoppable if they get early kills."_ About the class whose entire kit revolves around making it easy to get early kills...

The problem with being feast or famine is that in order to actually be worth anything in a game, an assassin will always need to be able to kill squishies, even when behind. _(Riot has even said as much, that they will always keep assassins capable of doing their job, even when behind)_
Therefore if they can always kill their target even when in 'famine', all being in 'feast' does, is make them able to kill even more people (which then makes them not an _'assassin'_ anymore).

I think that assassins should always be able to kill squishes no matter how far ahead/behind, but they should always have large periods of weakness afterwards.
Which is why I think assassins like Kassadin, Talon and LB are very balanced, they can devastate squishies very quickly, but after they have done so, they have to wait a significant period of time before being able to do anything else. and THATS the risk assassins should have to take.

They pick 1 **(ONE)** target, and obliterate them, then the fight basically becomes a 4v4. So the advantage of the assassin is that you make the fight a 4v4 but you get to choose which 1 of the enemy team isn't in the fight. Most assassins these days obliterate a target and still have enough in their kit to make the battle a meaningful 4v5.

____________

Think about how assassins function in real life. They go in, take out a high profile target and then either get caught and executed, or disappear into the night. Allowing the rest of the army to come in and defeat the leaderless enemy force.
The assassin doesn't come back wth the army smoking a cigar and duel wielding miniguns. They are sitting either in some seaside resort counting their prize money, or in a shallow Taliban grave in the desert. Either way they have done their job.  Why should league assassins be any different?

Ive said I think Shaco does this well, I think he's balanced when you consider the job he is supposed to do, especially when compared with other assassins, Isn't that enough?

I agree with Lord Sessh, while it certainly shouldn't be the case that most/every champ should be capable of one-shotting, there are certain champ that *should* be able to one-shot (Zoe, Veigar), and there should be certain champs that *should* be capable of one-shotting *under specific circumstances* (such as Assassin's when they're ahead by several levels and one or two items). Having a champ like Zed or Shaco who can't dish out a sh!t-tonne of burst to an enemy that is behind while they're ahead, particularly a squishy enemy like a marksman or mage, just doesn't make sense. Bursting enemies down is pretty much a given for assassin's, and that *should* result in one-shots (or near enough) when they have a significant enough lead.
